channel.title: Best internet providers?
channel.description:
What are the best/fastest internet providers at the cheapest price?
edit: i live in east coast us

item.title: Best internet providers?
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

That was never my statement. My statement was simply, “Where’s the bloody effort and innovation?” There isn’t any anymore. The ISP market is stale and boring. Why? Because there isn’t ANY competition. The ISPs divide areas they control to make sure there isn’t any competition in the market, and no one is doing anything about it. I’m not saying I think the companies should bankrupt themselves to deliver the service, I’m saying the companies should invest in getting the service out to us, as best they can. But they’re not even making an honest attempt at ANYTHING other than using ancient technology to make as much money as they can, without having to worry about competition. That’s the goal for ISPs, it probably was all along, and it seems they got it.

Way to misinterpret what I said though. =)

Read full topic

item.title: Best internet providers?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“hadesflames, post:17, topic:534066”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=652862.msg4375183#msg4375183 date=1381875258]

It’s 2013 and the fasted we can get is 100Mbps? lol no thanks.

i think you’re a bit deluded mate, there is no trend indicating that 100mbit connectivity should be affordable to household consumers

My point wasn’t about what is currently trending, it was about the tech we have available and what is possible. Affordable gbps internet is possible. Isps don’t do it because all they care about is making as much money using ancient technology as they can, consumer be damned.

if it was commercially viable then isps would be doing it everywhere. i’m sure we have the tech for 1gbps but someone has to pay for all that fiber and infrastructure.
[/quote]

Commercial viability doesn’t matter. They can still charge us massively for ancient technology because we let them, so they will. It’s not like I’m asking them to roll out fiber in the ENTIRE US by tomorrow. But they could have easily had fiber everywhere in the US if they had started rolling it out here and there little by little, and today we’d all have faster internet.[/quote]Well they are rolling it out, and they’ve been doing it for a long time. Pretty much all of the backbone networks are fiber. But upgrading the last mile is seriously expensive as you need new equipment and need to route fiber to each endpoint.

I do agree that many of the US ISPs have complete control over certain areas so there is little incentive for them to provide better service - I was just pointing out that “OMG ITS 2013 WHERES MY GBIT” is a pretty dumb statement. Companies shouldn’t have to do what they can’t afford just because the technology exists.

Read full topic

item.title: Best internet providers?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:11, topic:534066”]I’m paying over a hundred dollars a month for internet, but that’s my only choice because where I live. It’s either I fork out all that money and get decently bad internet or not have a connection at all. Luckily though, I can finally get a Verizon connection, which will probably be overpriced, but a ton faster than what I have now (and still probably cheaper!).[/quote]Well my comcast bill will probably become $100+ after my 12 month promotional but I will just cancel service/start new service to get a new promotion of some similar sort. Comcast is very lenient with customer service if you know how to talk to them

Like any other place they are a company that is in it for the money. The prices they/you offer/see are for the ones who aren’t willing to barter with them. They want your service cause they are still going to make plenty of profit.

As far as “consumer capable” speeds. Again it really and truly goes by the actual company.

-Is the isp a reseller?
-Where are the centers actually coming from ? ( is there internet being provided by a third party )
-location is key as well very important

Read full topic

item.title: Best internet providers?
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:14, topic:534066”][quote author=hadesflames link=topic=652862.msg4375168#msg4375168 date=1381871931]

It’s 2013 and the fasted we can get is 100Mbps? lol no thanks.

i think you’re a bit deluded mate, there is no trend indicating that 100mbit connectivity should be affordable to household consumers

My point wasn’t about what is currently trending, it was about the tech we have available and what is possible. Affordable gbps internet is possible. Isps don’t do it because all they care about is making as much money using ancient technology as they can, consumer be damned.
[/quote]
if it was commercially viable then isps would be doing it everywhere. i’m sure we have the tech for 1gbps but someone has to pay for all that fiber and infrastructure.[/quote]

Commercial viability doesn’t matter. They can still charge us massively for ancient technology because we let them, so they will. It’s not like I’m asking them to roll out fiber in the ENTIRE US by tomorrow. But they could have easily had fiber everywhere in the US if they had started rolling it out here and there little by little, and today we’d all have faster internet.

item.title: Best internet providers?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

xx matty xx:

if it was commercially viable then isps would be doing it everywhere. i’m sure we have the tech for 1gbps but someone has to pay for all that fiber and infrastructure.

Google easily has the cash on hand to roll out 1gbps fiber for the entire US twice, but that isn’t their plan. They are trying to force other competitors to step up and provide better service, quality, etc. Anyone notice AT&T trying to roll out high speed fiber in Austin, TX before Google? Their plan is working perfectly.

Read full topic

item.title: Best internet providers?
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

I’m paying over a hundred dollars a month for internet, but that’s my only choice because where I live. It’s either I fork out all that money and get decently bad internet or not have a connection at all. Luckily though, I can finally get a Verizon connection, which will probably be overpriced, but a ton faster than what I have now (and still probably cheaper!).

item.title: Best internet providers?
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

Loveandpower:

Comcast has excellent speeds if you don’t mind paying the price.

That’s a joke. Comcast is crap. They may have the fastest speeds out of all the isps in the US (except Google fiber) but it costs an arm and a leg, and it’s really NOT that fast. It’s 2013 and the fasted we can get is 100Mbps? lol no thanks.

chillwitm888:

If you’re in the states I’d recommend Verizon

Another joke. Verizon is more overpriced nonsense. They sell fiber and they charge as if they were trying to push 1Gbps speeds on copper. Gtfo…

In my honest opinion, I wouldn’t recommend ANY US based ISP to anyone unless I hated their guts. Unless they lived in Kansas City, in which case I’d urge them to sign up for Google Fiber.

Read full topic
